alert.note: Alert for Marshall; Wetzel (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 08 at 9:32PM EDT until June 08 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN WETZEL AND MARSHALL COUNTIES... At 931 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near New Martinsville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Wileyville. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
